text: Hi, I'm Francis, the host of this show, Cooking with Dog.
Konnichiwa.
Today, I am making easy-to-prepare Green Tea Ice Cream with no heating process, recommended to everyone.
Let's make green tea ice cream.
Place a bowl in ice water and let it cool down.
Pour whipping cream into the bowl.
Whip the cream with an electric mixer until it turns thick.
Pour milk into a container
and add brown sugar
and green tea powder.
Let the green tea powder sit in the mixture, otherwise it will splash all over the place.
Blend the mixture for 30 seconds.
Add the mixture to the whipping cream.
Gently stir the mixture while keeping the foam as it is.
It doesn't have to look even at this moment.
Keep the freezer bowl in the freezer for enough time before making ice cream.
Place the lid on and turn on the switch.
Pour the ice cream mixture into the freezer bowl.
The mixture will gradually become smoother as it mixes in the ice cream maker.
It will take about 20 minutes until it's ready to serve.
If you like the ice cream firmer, place the freezer bowl in the freezer for extra one hour after being processed.
Let's serve the green tea ice cream.
Turn off the switch and remove the lid.
Clean the paddle and remove.
Serve the brown rice flakes in a bowl
and add the premade shiratama dango.
Serve the premade red bean paste.
Scoop the green tea ice cream with a spoon.
Shape and make two balls.
Serve the ice cream
and add the brown rice flakes.
Put whipped cream on the ice cream.
Finally, garnish with caramel sauce.
There is no heating process for this recipe as it requires no egg yolk, making it fuss-free and easy to tackle.
It's worth using good-quality green tea powder for this recipe!
We highly recommend this tasty, but low-fat green tea ice cream recipe.
Good luck in the kitchen!
